comments: Booker (PHX) and Bane (MEM) engage and disengage with one another off ball.
Smith (PHX) establishes himself in a screening position in Bane's (MEM) view and gives Bane a step of distance to avoid the contact, which Smith absorbs.
Johnson (PHX) rests his right hand on Anderson's (MEM) right hip and quickly removes it as Anderson moves to set the pick.
Morant (MEM) brings his off-arm toward Johnson's (PHX) front and marginal contact occurs as Johnson reaches for the ball.
Johnson (PHX) moves alongside Morant's (MEM) path and marginal body contact occurs after Morant's gather.
Adams (MEM) and Smith (PHX) come together at the same spot and marginal contact occurs during rebounding.
Smith (PHX) extends his arm in pursuit of the rebound and incidental contact occurs with Adams (MEM) as Adams retrieves the ball.
Paul (PHX) stops short of Bane (MEM) as he cuts back and marginal body contact occurs at the end of Paul's drive.
Bane (MEM) extends his hand into Paul's (PHX) front and contact occurs while Paul is airborne during the shot attempt.
Johnson (PHX) stops short of Bane (MEM) and incidental foot-to-foot contact occurs after Bane receives the pass.
Bane (MEM) establishes his left foot as his pivot foot and he maintains his pivot after receiving the pass.
Smith (PHX) absorbs the contact to his forearm from Bane (MEM) and marginal contact occurs with Bane's left arm after he has released his shot attempt.

Booker (PHX) raises his right arm up as part of his natural shooting motion and marginal contact occurs with the side of Konchar's (MEM) head after the gather. Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Konchar (MEM) initiates contact across Booker's (PHX) left arm and causes Booker to lose control of the ball after his gather.
Booker (PHX) grasps and then quickly releases Morant's (MEM) jersey off-ball.
After Bane (MEM) makes initial contact with the ball, his hand comes off of the ball and marginal contact occurs with Smith's (PHX) right arm as Smith starts his dribble.
Paul (PHX) and Booker (PHX) initiate contact across Bane's (MEM) left and right arm, respectively, and affect Bane's ability to retrieve the loose ball.
Adams (MEM) rests his hand on Bridges' (PHX) side and marginal contact occurs during Bridges' upward shooting motion.
Adams (MEM) could be deemed to be in the lane for less than three seconds when the shot is imminent.
Paul (PHX) contests the jump shot attempt and marginal forearm contact occurs with Anderson's (MEM) lower half after the release.
Adams (MEM) grabs and holds Smith's (PHX) left arm during rebounding, affecting Smith's ability to secure the loose ball.
A shot clock violation is called on Memphis, however, the ball makes contact with the rim during the shot attempt.  This violation should have been reviewed.
Bane (MEM) and Booker (PHX) engage and disengage with one another during the inbound.
Smith (PHX) establishes himself in a screening position in Bane's (MEM) path and does not deliver the contact as Bane goes under.
Morant (MEM) establishes his left foot as his pivot foot and he slides his pivot foot at the start of his dribble.
Booker (PHX) is jumping to the side of Morant (MEM) and marginal body contact occurs as Morant fades away toward him during the driving shot attempt.
Morant (MEM) goes to, not through, Bridges' (PHX) space after they come together at the same spot after Morant's gather.
Morant (MEM) brings his off-arm toward Booker's (PHX) side as he is airborne during the driving shot attempt and marginal contact occurs.
Jackson Jr. (MEM) has his hands placed on Booker's (PHX) sides and quickly slides them off during the inbound.
Booker (PHX) and Morant (MEM) come together at the same spot along the perimeter and incidental body contact occurs.

Adams (MEM) maintains a legal guarding position during Bridges' (PHX) upward shooting motion. Any marginal contact that occurs is the result of Bridges' slightly extending his left leg outward toward Adams.
